climbs.name: Wound2Tight
climbs.fa: 2007 Andy Tretiakoff, Tony Lusk, Tony Horness

content.description: Sustained vertical face climbing on really fun route.
content.location: This route is the furthest route to the left (west) side of the wall.  Named for a local band.

climbs.name: TH & AT's Powder Adventure
climbs.fa: 2007 Andy Tretiakoff, Tony Lusk, Tony Horness

content.location: First route on the right side of the wall

climbs.name: Out of the Ashes
climbs.fa: 2007 Tony Lusk, Tony Horness, Andy Tretiakoff

content.location: 4th route from the right side of the wall

climbs.name: Lay Blackie
climbs.fa: 2007 Tony Horness, Tony Lusk, Andy Tretiakoff

content.description: Face climbing moves up the black stain.  This route stays on grade most of the way with a reprise at the ledge below the crux move at the top.
content.location: This route is the second one from the left side and is obvious because of the black stain running the length of the route

climbs.name: Grunge and Ashes
climbs.fa: 2007 Tony Lusk, Tony Horness, Andy Tretiakoff

content.location: This route is the 5th route from the right side of the wall

climbs.name: Bottom Feeder
climbs.fa: 2007 Tony Horness, Tony Lusk, Andy Tretiakoff

content.description: Very clean quality slab climbing.  This route originally was not going to be put up but it was fun enough to warrant some bolts
content.location: 2nd route from the right side of the wall

climbs.name: Black Forest
climbs.fa: 2007 Tony Lusk, Tony Horness, Andy Tretiakoff

content.location: 5th route from the left and about the middle of the wall

climbs.name: Black Death from Above
climbs.fa: 2007 Tony Lusk, Tony Horness, Andy Tretiakoff, Dave Weeks

content.description: There is a tall burned pine shadowing the climb hence the name
content.location: 4th route from the left side of the crag

climbs.name: Battle of My Bulge
climbs.fa: 2007 Tony Lusk, Tony Horness, Andy Tretiakoff, Dave Weeks

content.location: 3rd route from the left.  Route directly to the right of Lay Blackie and it goes up the obvious bulge

climbs.name: Ashes to Ashes
climbs.fa: 2007 Tony Lusk, Tony Horness, Andy Tretiakoff

content.description: Semi vertical face right facing gear corner TCU's and Camalots to #1
content.location: 3rd route from the right on the wall

content.description: This wall has a lot of fun face climbs that start out easier from the right and get progressively harder as you move to the climbers left.  The climbs on the left have shade from some of the trees.
